item.description: Much as I am enjoying iOS 15 (despite the havoc Safari is playing with my muscle memory), I’m not quite so keen on the subtle changes that seem to have destroyed every single on of my tortuously complicated Shortcuts.
Is it a government reshuffle, or is it just Johnson trolling a nation? Nadine Dorries? In the Cabinet? So hard to see how she’s better than, say, even the lamentable Williamson, who’s out.
Got a Literal.club account, hoping a shiny new site would help me reboot my lapsed reading habit. I just wasn’t ready for the criticism.

My favourite thing about Apple keynotes is how, every year, they remind me that I could be a great photographer. I just need a marginally better camera in my pocket than I have carried for the past year.

My first trip to the cinema since December 2019. I had quite forgotten how (once you are past the initial irritation) the reactive rustling of wrappers, murmurs, and throat-clearing add to the shared experience of movie watching!
Having spent a chunk of time this weekend tinkering with a new blog I suppose I’m going to have to put some content on the damn thing. Cue loss of inspiration, followed by crippling self-censorship.
